column5: Ive got a video file I ytook on my camera... its a mpg, and its less than a min long... but its like 55 mg... my software that i use (pinnicle) really doesnt like the file... anyone out there know how to reduce it in size fairly easly quickly... i can provide a download link...

TJ....are you using XP?  Try opening it in movie maker (supposed to come with XP) and then saving it as an .wmv file...at 768 to 1548 kb/s.  If PM the download link, I can look at it when I get home from work if it's not fixed by then.
lots of free or trail software out there  http://www.newfreedownloads.com/find/wmv-to-mpeg.html  if not I too could do it when I get home
Terry...I've tried lots ot those free trials....they all seem to work great, but I could do without the watermark on the finished video.  Lots will only convert the first 10 seconds etc.
I have Adobe Premier now...I thought I gave you Sony Vegas..it doesn't like it? Send me the link Tref.
Thanks guys I Rick got 'er done for me...  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=12611
